title: nf-core/eager pipeline parameters
description: A fully reproducible ancient and modern DNA pipeline in Nextflow and with cloud support.

input.description: Either paths to FASTQ/BAM data (must be surrounded with quotes). For paired end data, the path must use '{1,2}' notation to specify read pairs.                                       OR                                        A path to a TSV file (ending .tsv) containing file paths and sequencing/sample metadata. Allows for merging of multiple lanes/libraries/samples. Please see documentation for template.

single_end.description: Specifies that the input is single end reads. Not required for TSV input.
single_end.help_text: By default, the pipeline expects paired-end data. If you have single-end data, specify this parameter on the command line when you launch the pipeline. It is not possible to run a mixture of single-end and paired-end files in one run.

email.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed.

colour_chemistry.description: Define which colour chemistry to use.

single_stranded.description: Define whether to treat input data as single end (SE) data (not in TSV input mode).

bam.description: Specifies that the input is in BAM format. Not required for TSV input.

Input options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved.

save_reference.description: Turns on saving reference genome indices for later re-usage.

saveTrimmed.description: Turn this on if you want to keep trimmed reads.

saveAlignedIntermediates.description: Turn this on if you want to keep intermediate alignment files (SAM, BAM, non-deduped BAM)

snpcapture.description: Runs in SNPCapture mode (specify a BED file if you do this!).

run_convertinputbam.description: Turns on convertion of an input BAM file into FASTQ format before pre-processing (e.g. AdapterRemoval etc.).

fasta.description: Path and name of FASTA reference file (required if not iGenome reference). File suffixes can be: '.fa', '.fn', '.fna', '.fasta'
fasta.help_text: If you have no genome reference available, the pipeline can build one using a FASTA file. This requires additional time and resources, so it's better to use a pre-build index if possible.

genome.description: Name of iGenomes reference (required if not fasta reference).
genome.help_text: If using a reference genome configured in the pipeline using iGenomes, use this parameter to give the ID for the reference. This is then used to build the full paths for all required reference genome files e.g. `--genome GRCh38`.

igenomes_base.description: Directory / URL base for iGenomes references.

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

bwa_index.description: Path and name of a bwa indexed FASTA reference file without index suffixes (i.e. everything before the endings '.amb' '.ann' '.bwt'. Most likely the same value as --fasta)

bt2_index.description: Path and name of a bowtie2 indexed FASTA reference file without index index suffixes (i.e. everything before the endings e.g. '.1.bt2', '.2.bt2', '.rev.1.bt2'. Most likely the same value as --fasta)

bedfile.description: Path to BED file for SNPCapture methods.

seq_dict.description: Path to picard sequence dictionary file (typically ending in '.dict').

fasta_index.description: Path to samtools FASTA index (typically ending in '.fai').

large_ref.description: Turn this on if you have large reference genomes (e.g. plant genomes).

References.description: Optional additional pre-made indices, or you wish to overwrite any of the references.

name.help_text: A custom name for the pipeline run. Unlike the core nextflow `-name` option with one hyphen this parameter can be reused multiple times, for example if using `-resume`. Passed through to steps such as MultiQC and used for things like report filenames and titles.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

Generic options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
Generic options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested  for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

Max job request options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
Max job request options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

Institutional config options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
Institutional config options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

Skip Steps.description: Skip any of the mentioned steps.

complexity_filter_poly_g.description: Turn on running poly-G removal on FASTQ files. Will only be performed on 2 colour chemistry.

complexity_filter_poly_g_min.description: Specify length of poly-g min for clipping to be performed.

clip_forward_adaptor.description: Specify adapter sequence to be clipped off (forward).

clip_reverse_adaptor.description: Specify adapter sequence to be clipped off (reverse).

clip_readlength.description: Specify read minimum length to be kept for downstream analysis.

skip_collapse.description: Turn on skipping of merging forward and reverse reads together. Only applicable for PE libraries.

skip_trim.description: Turn on skipping of adapter and quality trimming

preserve5p.description: Turn on skipping 5p quality base trimming (n, score, window) at 5p end.

mergedonly.description: Turn on sending downstream only merged reads (un-merged reads and singletons are discarded).

mapper.description: Specify which mapper to use. Options: 'bwaaln', 'bwamem', 'circularmapper', 'bowtie2'.

bwaalnn.description: Specify the -n parameter for BWA aln.

bwaalnk.description: Specify the -k parameter for BWA aln.

bwaalnl.description: Specify the -l parameter for BWA aln.

circularextension.description: Specify the number of bases to extend reference by (circularmapper only).

circulartarget.description: Specify the target chromosome for CM (circularmapper only).

circularfilter.description: Turn on to filter off-target reads (circularmapper only).

bt2_alignmode.description: Specify the bowtie2 alignment mode. Options:  'local', 'end-to-end'.

bt2_sensitivity.description: Specify the level of sensitivity for the bowtie2 alignment mode. Options: 'no-preset', 'very-fast', 'fast', 'sensitive', 'very-sensitive'.

bt2n.description: Specify the -N parameter for bowtie2 (mismatches in seed). This will override defaults from alignmode/sensitivity.

bt2l.description: Specify the -L parameter for bowtie2 (length of seed substrings).

bt2_trim5.description: Specify number of bases to trim off from 5' (left) end of read before alignment.

bt2_trim3.description: Specify number of bases to trim off from 3' (right) end of read before alignment.

strip_input_fastq.description: Turn on creating pre-Adapter Removal FASTQ files without reads that mapped to reference (e.g. for public upload of privacy sensitive non-host data)

strip_mode.description: Stripping mode. Remove mapped reads completely from FASTQ (strip) or just mask mapped reads sequence by N (replace).

run_bam_filtering.description: Turn on samtools filter for mapping quality or unmapped reads of BAM files.

bam_mapping_quality_threshold.description: Minimum mapping quality for reads filter.

bam_discard_unmapped.description: Turns on discarding of unmapped reads in either FASTQ or BAM format, depending on choice (see --bam_unmapped_type).

bam_unmapped_type.description: efines whether to discard all unmapped reads, keep only bam and/or keep only fastq format Options: 'discard', 'bam', 'fastq', 'both'.

dedup_all_merged.description: Turn on treating all reads as merged reads.

preseq_step_size.description: Specify the step size of Preseq.

damageprofiler_threshold.description: Specify number of bases to consider for damageProfiler (e.g. on damage plot).

damageprofiler_yaxis.description: Specify the maximum misincorporation frequency that should be displayed on damage plot. Set to 0 to 'autoscale'.

udg_type.description: Specify here if you have UDG treated libraries, Set to 'half' for partial treatment, or 'full' for UDG. If not set, libraries are assumed to have no UDG treatment ('none').

pmdtools_range.description: Specify range of bases for PMDTools.

pmdtools_reference_mask.description: Specify a path to reference mask for PMDTools.

pmdtools_max_reads.description: Specify the maximum number of reads to consider for metrics generation.

run_bedtools_coverage.description: Turn on ability to calculate no. reads, depth and breadth coverage of features in reference.

anno_file.description: Path to GFF or BED file containing positions of features in reference file (--fasta). Path should be enclosed in quotes.

run_trim_bam.description: Turn on BAM trimming, for example for for full-UDG or half-UDG protocols.

bamutils_clip_left.description: Specify the number of bases to clip off reads from 'left' end of read.

bamutils_clip_right.description: Specify the number of bases to clip off reads from 'right' end of read.

bamutils_softclip.description: Turn on using softclip instead of hard masking.

run_genotyping.description: Turn on genotyping of BAM files.

genotyping_tool.description: Specify which genotyper to use either GATK UnifiedGenotyper, GATK HaplotypeCaller, Freebayes, or pileupCaller. Note: UnifiedGenotyper requires user-supplied defined GATK 3.5 jar file. Options: 'ug', 'hc', 'freebayes', 'pileupcaller', 'angsd'.

genotyping_source.description: Specify which input BAM to use for genotyping. Options: 'raw', 'trimmed' or 'pmd'.

gatk_ug_jar.description: When specifying to use GATK UnifiedGenotyper, path to GATK 3.5 .jar.

gatk_dbsnp.description: Specify VCF file for output VCF SNP annotation. Optional. Gzip not accepted.

gatk_hc_emitrefconf.description: Specify HaplotypeCaller mode for emitting reference confidence calls . Options: 'NONE', 'BP_RESOLUTION', 'GVCF'.

gatk_downsample.description: Maximum depth coverage allowed for genotyping before down-sampling is turned on.

gatk_ug_defaultbasequalities.description: Supply a default base quality if a read is missing a base quality score. Setting to -1 turns this off.

gatk_ug_keep_realign_bam.description: Specify to keep the BAM output of re-alignment around variants from GATK UnifiedGenotyper.

freebayes_C.description: Specify minimum required supporting observations to consider a variant.

freebayes_g.description: Specify to skip over regions of high depth by discarding alignments overlapping positions where total read depth is greater than specified in --freebayes_C.

freebayes_p.description: Specify ploidy of sample in FreeBayes.

pileupcaller_bedfile.description: Specify path to SNP panel in bed format for pileupCaller.

pileupcaller_snpfile.description: Specify path to SNP panel in EIGENSTRAT format for pileupCaller.

pileupcaller_method.description: Specify calling method to use. Options: 'randomHaploid', 'randomDiploid', 'majorityCall'.

angsd_glmodel.description: Specify which ANGSD genotyping likelihood model to use. Options: 'samtools', 'gatk', 'soapsnp', 'syk'.

angsd_glformat.description: Specify which output type to output ANGSD genotyping likelihood results: Options: 'text', 'binary', 'binary_three', 'beagle'.

angsd_createfasta.description: Turn on creation of FASTA from ANGSD genotyping likelhoood.

angsd_fastamethod.description: Specify which genotype type of 'base calling' to use for ANGSD FASTA generation. Options: 'random', 'common'.

run_vcf2genome.description: Turns on ability to create a consensus sequence FASTA file based on a UnifiedGenotyper VCF file and the original reference (only considers SNPs).

vcf2genome_outfile.description: Specify name of the output FASTA file containing the consensus sequence. Do not include `.vcf` in the file name.

vcf2genome_header.description: Specify the header name of the consensus sequence entry within the FASTA file.

vcf2genome_minc.description: Minimum depth coverage required for a call to be included (else N will be called).

vcf2genome_minq.description: Minimum genotyping quality of a call to be called. Else N will be called.

vcf2genome_minfreq.description: Minimum fraction of reads supporting a call to be included. Else N will be called.

run_multivcfanalyzer.description: Turn on MultiVCFAnalyzer. Note: This currently only supports diploid GATK UnifiedGenotyper input.

write_allele_frequencies.description: Turn on writing write allele frequencies in the SNP table.

min_genotype_quality.description: Specify the minimum genotyping quality threshold for a SNP to be called.

min_base_coverage.description: Specify the minimum number of reads a position needs to be covered to be considered for base calling.

min_allele_freq_hom.description: Specify the minimum allele frequency that a base requires to be considered a 'homozygous' call.

min_allele_freq_het.description: Specify the minimum allele frequency that a base requires to be considered a 'heterozygous' call.

additional_vcf_files.description: Specify paths to additional pre-made VCF files to be included in the SNP table generation. Use wildcard(s) for multiple files.

reference_gff_annotations.description: Specify path to the reference genome annotations in '.gff' format. Optional.

reference_gff_exclude.description: Specify path to the positions to be excluded in '.gff' format. Optional.

snp_eff_results.description: Specify path to the output file from SNP effect analysis in '.txt' format. Optional.

run_mtnucratio.description: Turn on mitochondrial to nuclear ratio calculation.

mtnucratio_header.description: Specify the name of the reference FASTA entry corresponding to the mitochondrial genome (up to the first space).

run_sexdeterrmine.description: Turn on sex determination for human reference genomes.

sexdeterrmine_bedfile.description: Specify path to SNP panel in bed format for error bar calculation. Optional (see documentation).

run_nuclear_contamination.description: Turn on nuclear contamination estimation for human reference genomes.

contamination_chrom_name.description: The name of the chromosome in your bam. 'X' for hs37d5, 'chrX' for HG19.

run_metagenomic_screening.description: Turn on metagenomic screening module for reference-unmapped reads

metagenomic_tool.description: Specify which classifier to use. Options: 'malt', 'kraken'.

database.description: Specify path to classifer database directory. For Kraken2 this can also be a `.tar.gz` of the directory.

metagenomic_min_support_reads.description: Specify a minimum number of reads  a taxon of sample total is required to have to be retained.

percent_identity.description: Percent identity value threshold for MALT.

malt_mode.description: Specify which alignment method to use for MALT. Options: 'Unknown', 'BlastN', 'BlastP', 'BlastX', 'Classifier'.

malt_alignment_mode.description: Specify alignment method for MALT. Options: 'Local', 'SemiGlobal'.

malt_top_percent.description: Specify the percent for LCA algorithm for MALT (see MEGAN6 CE manual).

malt_min_support_mode.description: Specify whether to use percent or raw number of reads for minimum support required for taxon to be retained for MALT. Options: 'percent', 'reads'.

malt_min_support_percent.description: Specify the minimum percentage of reads a taxon of sample total is required to have to be retained for MALT.

malt_max_queries.description: Specify the maximium number of queries a read can have for MALT.

malt_memory_mode.description: Specify the memory load method. Do not use 'map' with GTFS file system for MALT. Options: 'load', 'page', 'map'.

run_maltextract.description: Turn on MaltExtract for MALT aDNA characteristics authentication

maltextract_taxon_list.description: Path to a txt file with taxa of interest (one taxon per row, NCBI taxonomy name format)

maltextract_ncbifiles.description: Path to directory containing containing NCBI resource files (ncbi.tre and ncbi.map; avaliable: https://github.com/rhuebler/HOPS/)

maltextract_filter.description: Specify which MaltExtract filter to use. Options: 'def_anc', 'ancient', 'default', 'crawl', 'scan', 'srna', 'assignment'.

maltextract_toppercent.description: Specify percent of top alignments to use.

maltextract_matches.description: Turn on exporting alignments of hits in BLAST format.

maltextract_megansummary.description: Turn on export of MEGAN summary files.

maltextract_percentidentity.description: Minimum percent identity alignments are required to have to be reported. Recommended to set same as MALT parameter.

maltextract_topalignment.description: Turn on using top alignments per read after filtering.

maltextract_singlestranded.description: Set this to true if single stranded data is analyzed.
